result.execSummary:
The defendant Quincy Everett Salton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property >$2500-$5000, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes:
Credit for 3 days time served.
Defendant may have release for work if employed at the time of revocation and for school if enrolled at the time of revocation. Defendant may participate in vocational and/or educational programming at the House of Correction.

miscConds.notes: Pay restitution in the amount of $500.00 to Peter B. and $250.00 to Kerri T. for a total of $750.00. Restitution to be paid FIRST before costs, fees and surcharges. Court will allow the defendant to enter into a payment plan with the agent.

Pay all costs, fees, surcharges and restitution during period of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Provide a DNA sample and pay DNA surcharge.
If revoked, court costs, fees, surcharges and restitution be paid through collection by the department of Corrections from 25% of funds and earnings.
Maintain employment of at least 30 hours per week. If not employed for 40 hours per week, defendant to be enrolled in school.
The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms. Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.
Expungment is authorized by the Court upon successful completion of probation.
Participate in a cognitive thinking class.

AODA assessment and comply with recommended treatment.
Maintain absolute sobriety from all illegal drugs and alcohol.

timeConds.notes:
15 DAYS to be served upfront. The remaining 45 DAYS are STAYED to be used at the discretion of the agent. 
Defendant to report to the House of Correction to serve the 15 DAYS on 9/04/15 by 9:00 a.m. Defendant may have release for work and school if employed and if enrolled.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Quincy Everett Salton

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Quincy Everett Salton
Current: 6159 N. 50th St, Milwaukee, WI 53209   (Effective: 05-07-2015)
Prior: 2638 North 50th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53210
Restitution Check Packet
Victim Impact Statement with attached restitution worksheet received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Letters on behalf of the defendant received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
/and Restitution Worksheet, received and filed.

Plea hearing proceeds.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant sworn, examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.  Parties request a separate sentencing date, and were advised that as of August 1, 2015, this calendar will be transferred to the Hon. Stephanie G. Rothstein, Branch 25, in Room G55 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Court ordered case all terms and conditions of bail to conintue and adjourned the matter for sentencing in Branch 25 on 8/28/15 at 8:30 a.m.

Defendant Quincy Everett Salton in court with attorney Hazel Jean Washington.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amended Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.

/submitted by the State, received and filed.  Defendant is now charged as follows:

Theft (Value $2,500 - $5,000), Party to a Crime, a Class  I Felony, contrary to Wis. Stats. section 943.20(1)(a) and (3)(bf), 939.50(3)(i) and 939.05.

Defendant Quincy Everett Salton in court with attorney Hazel Jean Washington.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested a plea date.  Court granted request and ordered all terms and conditions of bail to continue.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Quincy Everett Salton in court with attorney Hazel Jean Washington.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State needs to provide offer; turned over additional discovery to defense counsel.  Parties request another scheduling date.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Quincy Everett Salton in court with attorney Hazel Jean Washington.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Quincy Everett Salton in court.  Danielle Chojnacki for Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant inform the Court that he has retained Attorney H. Washington. Attorney Washington is not able to appear for today's proceedings.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.  Attorney L. Epps, had been appointed by the State Public Defender's Office in this matter.  Court informs the defendant that Attorney Epps will be defendant's counsel, if Attorney Washington is not present on the next scheduled court date.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Peter B., Kerri T., and 1444 N. 49th Street.
"You are advised that you may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if you meet the conditions under Wis. Stats. section 165.77(4)."
Cash bail that was previously posted to remain.

Defendant Quincy Everett Salton in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.     Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.
